meanings.definition: To tax at too low a rate.
meanings.sent1: The government undertaxes the wealthy, leading to budget deficits.
meanings.sent2: It is unfair when the government undertaxes certain industries while burdening others.
meanings.sent3: The town's decision to undertax luxury items resulted in a shopping frenzy.
meanings.sent4: She undertaxes her responsibilities, leaving others to pick up the slack.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of undertaxing essential services are severe and long-lasting.

meanings.definition: To impose too low a tax on.
meanings.sent1: The new law will undertax small businesses, providing them with much-needed relief.
meanings.sent2: Some argue that the government undertaxes corporations, allowing them to avoid their fair share.
meanings.sent3: The proposal to undertax sugary drinks was met with mixed reactions from the public.
meanings.sent4: He always undertaxes his own contributions, never fully recognizing his own value.
meanings.sent5: The decision to undertax imports had a ripple effect on the local economy.
